item.description: This page lists Pascal Michaillat's research papers.

item.description: Under simple but realistic assumptions, the efficient unemployment rate u* is the geometric average of the unemployment and vacancy rates.

item.title: Critical Values Robust to P-Hacking
item.description: This paper develops a model of p-hacking by researchers. It then gives critical values that correct the inflated type 1 error rates caused by p-hacking.

item.title: Beveridgean Unemployment Gap
item.description: This paper develops a sufficient-statistic formula for the unemployment gap based on the Beveridge curve. The US gap is countercyclical and often positive.

item.title: Resolving New Keynesian Anomalies with Wealth in the Utility Function
item.description: This paper resolves all the anomalies of the New Keynesian model at the zero lower bound by introducing wealth into the utility function.

item.title: Persistence of False Paradigms in Low-Power Sciences
item.description: This paper develops a model of science. It shows that due to homophily in tenure decisions, false paradigms may persist when a science has low power.
